category-def.name: Refactory Core
category-def.label: Refactory Core
category-def.description: Contains all core features needed to use Refactory.

category-def.name: Refactory Editor Connectors
category-def.label: Refactory Editor Connectors
category-def.description: Contains all currently available editor connectors. An editor connector is used to support additional editors containing EMF-based models (in particular EObjects). If one provides a new editor connector it is possible to invoke model refactorings via right-clicking model elements in this editor.

category-def.name: Refactory Mappings
category-def.label: Refactory Mappings
category-def.description: To provide refactorings for a concrete modeling language a mapping from generic refactorings to the metamodel is needed. This category contains some default mappings to directly support refactorings for ecore, UML or BPMN.

category-def.name: Refactory Constraint Interpreter
category-def.label: Refactory Constraint Interpreter
category-def.description: Refactorings can only be executed if pre- and post-conditions are satisfied. This category provides a default contraint interpreter for OCL. This interpreter uses the implementation of Dresden OCL (http://www.dresden-ocl.org).

category-def.name: Refactory Smells
category-def.label: Refactory Smells
category-def.description: Use the features contained herein to support quality smells. They indicate structures badly satisfying specific qualities. One can register refactorings for quality smells which then will be provided as quick fixes to resolve the quality smells.
